roles.title: Designer
roles.description: Designs the user interface and experience for the data annotation and review tool, ensuring it is intuitive, efficient, and accessible.

roles.title: Engineer
roles.description: Builds and maintains the data collection, annotation, and processing pipeline, including the user-facing tool and data packaging scripts.

roles.title: Prompt Engineer
roles.description: Defines the dataset schema, structures the data generation workflow, engineers prompts for TAS extraction, and oversees the quality control process.

roles.title: Task-Agnostic Step (TAS) extractor
roles.description: Processes raw input data (e.g., high-level goals, project plans) to identify and extract Task-Agnostic Steps (TAS).

steps.name: Lyra
steps.task: Define the schema and format for the fine-tuning dataset, specifying the structure of input (e.g., high-level goal) and output (e.g., extracted TAS).

steps.name: Lyra
steps.task: Establish criteria for sourcing raw data and create a plan for gathering diverse examples of high-level goals and project descriptions.

steps.name: Aurora
steps.task: Design a user-friendly interface for annotating, reviewing, and validating the extracted TAS data to ensure dataset quality.

steps.name: Kodax
steps.task: Implement the front-end and back-end for the data annotation and review tool based on Aurora's design.

steps.name: Lyra
steps.task: Develop and refine the system prompts for uTASe to maximize the accuracy and relevance of the extracted TAS.

steps.name: uTASe
steps.task: Execute the primary extraction process by analyzing the sourced raw data to identify and list all Task-Agnostic Steps.

steps.name: Lyra
steps.task: Structure the raw output from uTASe into the predefined dataset schema, creating clean prompt-completion pairs for the LLM.

steps.name: Kodax
steps.task: Write and deploy scripts to automate the final packaging of the validated dataset into a machine-readable format (e.g., JSONL) suitable for fine-tuning.
